newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa to revise up gold 1996 gold exports - paper.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa to revise up gold 1996 gold exports - paper.

text.p: The South African Reserve Bank is to revise upwards the figures for net gold exports in the second and third quarters of 1996, Business Day newspaper reported on Monday.
The move means the current account deficit was better and capital flows worse than originally estimated.

In December the Reserve Bank revised the 1995 current account deficit to 10.157 billion rand compared with a previously announced figure of 12.656 billion after revising gold exports which officials said at the time had not previously been included.
Net gold exports in 1995 were revised to 22.537 billion rand from a previously announced 20.153 billion rand.
Business Day said a further revision would be published in the central bank's Quarterly Bulletin in March.

A bank official said the latest reason for the revision was that preliminary data, on which the initial estimates of net gold exports were based were incomplete and more comprehensive data had now become available.
